sentence.Network_en: In the year 1700, about 60 million bison wandered freely in North America.
sentence.Network_cn: 在1700年约有6000万头野牛在北美无拘无束地活动.

sentence.Network_en: Large herds of bison used to live on the plains of North America.
sentence.Network_cn: 大群的野牛过去曾生活在北美大草原上.

月份与星期的英文_百度文库 ... wildcat 野猫 bison 美洲野牛 yak 牦牛.
北美野牛(Bison)看起来很温顺，行动缓慢，但实际上是一种危险的动物。这种动物重900公斤，如果跑起来比人的速度快三倍。
以为美国人很忌讳拳王叫拜森（Bison），因为怕影射美国拳手泰森（Tyson），所以做了名字大调整。至于在日本，对此反响不大。

bison waste no longer fell on the ground to improve the soil , which as a result ( = with the result that it ) became less good for growing plants .野牛的粪便不再落在土地上以改善土壤，结果土壤变得越发不利于植物的生长。
a wild bison strayed out of its habitat and went on rampage in a village in West Bengal killing and injuring six others .一头野牛溜达出了自己的栖息地，在孟加拉邦的一个村庄里横冲直撞，致使一人死亡，六人受伤。
bison used to roam through the american great plains , but most of them be slaughter by hunter从前野牛在美国大平原上漫游，但是大多数都被猎人屠杀了

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin, ultimately of Germanic origin and related to wisent

entry.def: A bison is a large hairy animal with a large head that is a member of the cattle family. They used to be very common in North America and Europe.

means.word_mean: 1. any of several large shaggy-maned humped bovids having large heads and short horns
